snippet: Clarinda Mac Low stages improvisations in the spirit of the 1960s New York institution the Judson Dance Theater.
abstract: Gia Kourlas reviews performance of 40 Dancers do 40 Dances for the Dancers, a project conceived and directed by Clarinda Mac Low, at Danspace Project at St Marks Church; performance is part of Platform 2012: Judson Now, a series celebrating the 50th anniversary of the Judson Dance Theater.
lead_paragraph: Clarinda Mac Low stages improvisations in the spirit of the 1960s New York institution the Judson Dance Theater.

headline.seo: Clarinda Mac Low and Simone Forti Recall Judson Dance Era
headline.main: A ’60s Landmark in the Eyes of Children
headline.print_headline: A ’60s Landmark In the Eyes of Children
